jcpJySpD4YmfC9Srwl3AbA.text: Have been here twice now, both times just turned up with family/friends for a drink with no reservation. The staff have been good, getting us a table straight away (although don't move the chairs to a different table or you will get told off!). The drinks are expensive, as one would expect, but they aren't too bad. A bottle of wine is currently £32, so not bad if there's a few of you. Beers were around £5-6 and cocktails £12. It is a nice relaxed atmosphere and on Monday night there was a band and lounge singer for entertainment. The view is amazing as expected and it is a cheap way of getting close to the view from the shard. The bar serves food although we didn't look at the menu so can't comment.

LtreEu5WQpUyuJa35F6Jvg.text: Awesome live music on Saturday night (retro covers of outkast, Beyoncé, Stevie wonder).  View and drinks were also excellent.  Not cheap though.

IkEC2Qenl1v8Zcaut7FdOw.text: The lounge area was great. Live music and an amazing view. The view from the restaurant was even better. The best service and food I've had. The steak was the best ever in fact! The photos of the view don't do London justice

photos.caption: Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom. View from the restaurant
Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom. Grilled tiger prawn, rosemary and olive oil
Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom. French fries

GJ64zR8S75VM47yEOi2YXg.text: Love, love, love this place. The food was fantastic. Be sure to try the salt and vinegar squid. It's great. Great ambiance, live music was great, very good service. Friendly, helpful staff. Great views of the city from the 32nd floor so what more could you ask for? Highly recommend it.

r49S4HDePXOCC-wwRFJKQA.text: I should have known we were in trouble when we approached the hostess station and were greeted by Chav clones wearing the same matchy-matchy dresses that looked like they were made from the curtains from my grandma's rest home.  Oh so preciously cutesy.   After circling us with their exacting eye to ensure we qualified for entry into the hallowed domain, Clone Chav #1 sniffed that some people have the audacity to wear casual shoes!!!!!     (Oh the horror!   I know when I crawl on the floor under a table in a restaurant the last thing I want to see are casual shoes! ).    After being deemed good enough we were allowed to enter where we then encountered the level of service and food quality one usually gets at a Pret a Manger.  Baby pablum has more flavor and the service was inattentive, at best.   Not just bad, but laughably bad, except for the fact it cost a pretty penny.   My boyfriend joked that he kinda ended up wishing we hadn't made the cut!   Best advice is go across the lobby to the Aqua Shard bar.  Same view without the lousy service and food.

Bwj5NLsteirqqcWiCzNeyA.text: I love this place! Both lounge and the restaurant have an amazing view through the glass windows.Cocktails are tasty and the food is also nice, but vegetarians should say away as there's not much for them to eat at Oblix.

ENZVrGkz1wM-plHfdeG2vQ.text: Wow! First, the view is unbeatable. In the bar you look out on the Tower and London Bridge.  Then, look at St. Paul's lit up and stunning. Live music was great. Then, dinner, which included incredibly delicious and unique dishes. The truffle flatbread started is huge and divine.  Then, I had the suckling pig. Fabulous!  Well worth the slightly higher price for the one of a kind view and experience.

tNgEnOglFLfQF8kAyiPMAA.text: Came to the bar here one night.Very crowded. Not enough seating.Decent wines on offer and some OK value, too. Terrible beer list.Great views.

eMKYu0KyIF2OwlAW0i9z2A.text: We have had a lot of problems finding a meal that satisfies the 5 of us in London and Oblix did it! The food was incredible, and exceeded all expectations and preconceived notions of what food is in London. The staff is so friendly, the view is so beautiful, and the food is absolutely incredible. The portions are the perfect size to let you save room for dessert, so that you aren't super full. For anyone trying to find edible and beyond great food in London, I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS.**important to note: please make sure when coming that you wear elegant clothing, they won't let you in with trainers on**

8WPJetXQJ9kvz3EILJRNmA.text: Went there primarily for the view, but the food and service was surprisingly good. Had the monk fish (light and excellent flavor). Friends had the roast chicken & steak, all were happy with their choice. Would be nice if you had the option of reserving a table by the windows.

Duf-87VGCzSmm8i3_lEMYg.text: London, England - The Shard Tower - Absolute must.Lucky enough to dine on opening nite.  Literally lucky enough.  Arrived on a whim after visiting the observation deck at the Shard the day before.  So, didn't have the luxury to check Yelp prior to visiting.Upon entry immediately noticed a ton of suits and the guys who ordered drinks before me had their AMEX Black Cards ready to go.  I on the other hand was damn stoked to be in such a cool spot in London. Of course the place was sold out and I was immediately denied a dining opportunity. However, after doing what I do best staff asked the Bar Manager and he offered me one of the lounge tables (seating up to 4) as long as I can bounce in 2.5 hours - DONE!As I sat down and handed a menu one of the two suits I chatted up for a bit earlier in the evening came back from the Dining room, looking for me and asked to join his partner at their 4 top.  No Brainer!  So I kindly and appropriately thanked the manager for his earlier gesture of hospitality and made my way into the dining room.The three of us did some damage.  Sure if we had more people then guess what?  We would have ordered more.  All in all - The Bone-In Rib Eye was amazing, the sirloin was nice and the Waygu didn't arrive... Understandably there are some quirks - other than that all the sides were okay, carrots, mushrooms, mashed potatoes, chips and there bread was fantastic.  No other place like this in London, with the view, good food and good live jazz.  I highly recommend this place to be on the "to do" list while in London.Keep in mind there are two areas, the lounge/bar with the music.  You can eat there as well but the actual bar does not offer a menu (soon to occur).  I prefer and ate on the otherside where you can see the kitchen and is more of a dining room.  Both have good vibes.So the bottom line is I came solo, had No Reservation and straight up made the most of it.  Better yet on opening night.  When I decide to visit London again I wouldn't mind trying it out again.  Only Word of Caution!   Yes the venue is great, food (when it arrives) is solid but from what I experienced and from the reviews on Trip A***** they are still having communciation issues, refering to the service.Seems so odd - that service is all over the place given the greeting you receive prior to the elevators and upon arrival to the restaurant - the girls with their ipads and stoic expressions make you feel as if this place is 100% on point, but Not - yet

zEE3ZIZ-mlwI_HqW_1XbOQ.text: I haven't tried the food, so reporting on the bar only!Enjoy your drink with some stunning views around. I loved this place - it's classy in a modern way. Or modern in a classy way! A leather covered lift takes you up swiftly up to the 32nd floor and you think you're prepared to see what's coming - but you really are not. I went there on a sunny evening of a Thursday and enjoyed a perfectly made Manhattan and a bunch of white wine spritzers. They have comfy sofas and pouffes around low coffee tables so you can enjoy your (very expensive!) alcohol with a bunch of friends while listening to a live band performance.They have table service - I love bars that have that - but it may also mean you may get more drunk than you've planned - just because you no longer need to make that trip to the bar.People are normal City folk - probably more mature than, say, the Folly.Definitely recommend - but be prepared to pay, I found it quite annoying that ordering at the bar still includes service charge. And also - no bar snacks - only peanuts with bacon - I would have expected a wider selection for a place like that. Hence - the 4 not 5 stars.

RUEnJ-x6_xkVMgCZDKEHMg.text: What a view! and great food. Oblix is necessarily going to be compared to Galvin at Windows, and I would say it succeeds on the trendy, sharp-dressers, slick-side of things where Galvin is more 'comfortable' in it's presentation. However, I would say that Galvin's cuisine is "remarkable" & "exceptional", whereas Oblix "did not disappoint."Oblix feels completely over-staffed when you arrive : 3 women with iPads greet you, there are then a plethora of young men (footmen? runners? greeters?) standing in the corridor behind them.We arrived for an early seating, and seemed to catch the tail-end of the afternoon crowd (at 6:30pm). Booking so far in advance we were able to have excellent seats at the window with a view over the Thames towards St Paul's. By sunset (after 8pm) it was just breath-taking : and that is what you're paying for!Food was good - lovely starters, fresh, adventurous, beautifully presented. Mains - also good, altho' we felt our beef tenderloin was slightly over-done and we ordered it rare/medium-rare. The sauces it is served with are delicious, and generous. Sides - I didn't want to order anything I could make at home, so we went for the carrots, in honey and ginger. They're smoked, so it's quite a strong flavour. Hmmm... not my taste. Cauliflower roasted with peanuts, caper berry sauce and passion fruit - an interesting take on a veggie everyone avoids. Good call, mr waiter.Desserts were excellent. Wish I could have had 3 ;-)Wines. sigh... this is where they fell down. We both had a glass of white (two different estates) to start and both were lack-lustre. I then had a second white, this time an Austrian Riesling (£15/glass). Nope, it was also a disappointment. However, we did have an Australian red with the beef, and that was really good. I hope they'll revise their wine list (by the glass), it needs attention.In contrast to John (previous reviewer), we felt the service was very attentive and although it got much busier as the evening progressed, we were able to catch a waiter's eye whenever we needed anything.Would I go back ? yes, definitely.I want to try out the bar next time, which also serves food (you can book a table if you're eating there) and the live jazz drew us in (£12 cover charge apparently). See you soon Oblix

photos.caption: Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom. Shakin' it down
Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom. Salmon flatbread

fxQMftdEMl-xA-VkNZqp1A.text: A lovely restaurant along with an amazing view across London the staff are very polite and friendly and the food is very nice and too marks for presentation I highly recommend to anyone who wants a giid evening out or lunchtime nibbles.

photos.caption: Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom

FUol1rHuyhuA-grdUiPjUA.text: Worthwhile going not just for the view but also for world class food!Fantastic atmosphere, London's view is really breathtaking very well partnered with refined dishes from starter to desert.

7F8v8ndHwHRX6-0FCaN7ew.text: I had breakfast meeting in the restaurant. Food was cold and service was poor. View is great.

6Yu1aeXIl5P01Y8K3HvX8g.text: Went for our anniversary. Was very impressed by the food. Drinks were reasonably expensive. Amazing atmosphere and ofcourse unbelievable .:)

XKSWaVZ_H4A2Ay-FObZcIQ.text: The small bites calamari might be the best I've ever had.  No joke.And the view is great. The wine selection is excellent.  Get a bottle. Olives are fresh and amazing. Get them too. This place would be great for a date!If you ask for tap water. ..you will get refills without asking. AMAZING

YAHI4xTlvbtVRz3FlRV3ow.text: Came here after a birthday dinner by accident on our way to aqua shard.  Turned out to be a great mistake! The place is elegant and gives you your own personal space (not to mention an amazing view as well of the entire city of London).  We only had a cocktail each but they were fantastic.

RkSxNC0T92NA_ps1pZWukg.text: we have been there a few times, the service is excellent, the view is wonderful, the food on the other hand is hit and miss, sometimes is very good, but sometimes is a little bit of a let-down. Now I learn that the pork is always more delicious as if I order the steak (medium rare) sometimes is good and sometimes is tough maybe it is the way steak is. All and all it was always good experience and we will be back again.

2LDRlefmPvDFuJ1zKVotOQ.text: While vacationing in London, we had the opportunity to eat here. We were so lucky that it was clear outside so had an amazing view. We all enjoyed our food but it was quite pricey for lunch. We had no issues with this since we were mostly paying for the experience. I had the steak and it tasted nice. My boyfriend had the pork belly and it was delicious! Glad our friend set up reservations here during our trip!

9nXiXQF2sqs7ptf8m-UkCw.text: The only thing separating this from any other classy bar is the view. Yes, the drinks were good, they have a great selection of whiskey and bourbon, and the hostesses wear cute dresses. But at the end of the day all you've got is a bar on the 32nd floor overlooking South London. You can't even see St Paul's. It was a little noisy - some sound partitioning would be nice. We came without a reservation and needed a table for three, but apparently all they had (at 5:00 on a Monday) was a giant booth, and they needed to kick us out at 6. They didn't offer us a food menu either, even though there were little cakes and things sitting out on the counter.

QfOBg8uC0Aw3X0C1z0Op8A.text: Thank goodness for the excellent martinis that helped soften the blow of the experience. The view was lovely and the service at the start equally matched. Then arrived the sommelier who requested our wine choice prior to our ordering our mains, of which he specifically helped pick out a pinot noir that would accompany our lobster. The wine is served even though we have yet to order our mains. Finally our server arrives only to relay they are out of lobster of which the sommelier had specifically paired our wine. Thus we pick alternative mains and are stuck with the wine. My sea bass fills the plate in a lump with no flavour. P's tiger prawn is one whole piece from head to end and not much meat in between, with eyeballs to boot! We've ordered a take away bag to give to a rough sleeper on the way out. There are no questions why we've left most of our food untouched. Our server long ago exited without relaying and 3 different staff interactions followed. I was pleased with our bill as the £85 bottle of pinot noir was excluded however gut feeling stated this was most likely unintended. Whilst I'd like to have retained the "stupidity tax" I relayed the error to a new server who then brought over the manager. No apologies or discount of gratitude for their error was acknowledged as they took a separate payment for the full £85 bottle. I'd say lack of communication from management down killed a potentially conducive elegant dining experience.

-t-VeE1TEL2cLwP3ksf2qg.text: There are lots of amazing things about Oblix, no doubt.The view is fantastic.  In the restaurant, you get the London Eye, St. Paul's, BT Tower, etc.  In the Lounge, you get a stellar view of Tower Bridge and Canary Wharf.  The service is impeccable.  They had no qualms about letting us switch tables for dessert to one that was up against the windows.  The hostess will lead you to your table, and wait for your entire party to join, despite your pausing at the windows to marvel.  Most interesting to me, in order to get to your table, you must walk through the entire kitchen, where many of the chefs are happy to tell you hello on arrival, and thank you on exit.That being said... the food was a killer for me.  Was it bad? No.  But it was just decent, and I was hoping for so much more.  Generally speaking, there was a total lack of salt in almost every dish.  And we ordered several.  The lobster and scallop ceviche was definitely my favorite starter, with the veal chop being a solid main (and one of the only items with seasoning, although still lacking a bit of salt), and the best side was the corn with truffle.  Also tasty is the duck from the rotisserie.  The bone-in ribeye was sadly flavorless and slightly overcooked.  The pork belly was very eh.  The mac and cheese, which when done well is my favorite food on the earth, was so lackluster I wouldn't recommend that anyone give it a go.  It was void of both the cheesiness and the creaminess I believe mac requires.  The seared scallop starter was half chewy (one scallop) and half fine (the other scallop).  And so on.Beware the snarky sommelier who hates Malbecs and will chide your group ("Malbecs are the PIzza Hut of wines.") for even mentioning them!Oblix is worth a go if only for the view alone, but be careful what you order lest you face disappointment!

Y_EjihjFf6PKKllA55rk6Q.text: Went to the lounge for dinner, The view is amazing, there is a problem with the acoustics in the room and we struggled to hear the people at our table, this was not helped by rather loud background noise.   We had to wait 40 mins for our table but they were good and gave us free champagne, by the time we got our table we had lost our appetites and so decided to skip the appetiser and just have a main course, the server was unhappy with this and said that because we did not order an appetiser we would have to wait at least 40 minutes for our meals, that would have been 1.5 hours after our reservation and so we complained and the main courses appeared after 20 mins.  I had the black code which was cooked with BBQ sauce rather than Miso, it was ok but the sauce over powered the dish.  The food was generally good but not great.  The manager listened to our views and gave us a sample plate of all of the deserts on the house, they were very good, we enjoyed them all......net net ..a well managed restaurant, very busy, great view, I would go back but for lunch rather than dinner.

MDbsrnYiAS7Q8PoZ45vDtw.text: I came here whilst working in London a few weeks back, more on research for a place to dine at over Christmas.  What takes you back initially, is the Shard itself & going up in a lift that only stops at this floor... prepare for your ears to get sucked in, as it's rapid!Really friendly welcome, but as we were 30 minutes early, just had a drink in the bar whilst the table was made ready.  Randomly, we sat here for 45 minutes & I had to eventually ask if the table was ready, given they never called us over.I don't get the dark corridors between the bar and the restaurant. It's a bit daft and ponsey, even by my standards!  Views however, are breathtaking up here and that makes up for the other parts you might not like!Only stuck with 2 glasses of wine, as at £12 a glass, you really didn't want to go crazy here!  Starters, I went for the Scallops and my friend had the smoked salmon flat bread.OMG.. these scallops were ridiculous!  Hands down the BEST I've ever had anywhere in the world.  Hand dived and grilled in a sauce I cannot even describe, but you are transcended into another level eating these.  At £16.50 for two (cut in half!), you really had to be to not feel cheated!  My friend couldn't eat her flat bread, as it was the size of a pizza.  I really don't like smoked salmon, but I thought I'd give it a go & ended up eating half of it... safe to say, I like Oblix smoked salmon!Mains, I went for sirloin steak, as recommended by the waiter, reasonable at £35 (for London!) and my mate had the king prawn.  Sides of creamy mash, mac and cheese and chunky chips.  Again.... OMG.  Damn, this was a fine steak cooked to perfection, but more than that.. it was tender and bursting with epic natural flavours. In the top five steaks I've had worldwide, easily.  Couldn't not have dessert and spying a New York Cheesecake, I had to have it.  It was nice, but not awesome & I've made much better myself.  3/5 for that, but majority of folk will still love it. Bill for two with two glasses of wine and service charge, came to £160.  Given I just paid £145 to MPW in Glasgow, this was worth every single penny & you didn't feel cheated or begrudged paying.  With those views, the service and the food to match, this was also more of an experience than just having a bite to eat.  I've booked it in October to take our Fiona for dinner when we are away ourselves, it really is that good.  Book well in advance and you WILL NOT be disappointed!You Gotta Eat Here - NOW!!! :-D

photos.caption: Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom. Sirloin Steak to die for

_QfxPxdYgG7bWLuzDC8Zcg.text: Ate here over a year ago and still can remember how good the food was and the tofu that came with the curry Shrimp even tasted goodThe picture from over a year ago proves how good the food looked and tasted I'd still have the picture

photos.caption: Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom. This was there curry Lakshmi of shrimp and tofu

BruwWxEwHO7p69GaQxK92A.text: I've been to this place twice and have had a delicious experience both times. Although the menu and drinks are a bit pricey, the quality and unique taste are well worth the money. The service is top quality and the view is amazing as well. I'll be coming back here whenever I'm in London!

ZrB9YG3Q_fBBW2XQtHm3DQ.text: Going to a newly opened restaurant is great, but rolling 6 deep with group of yelpers is AWESOME. Why? We all want to try everything. We all share the dishes family style and get to sampler more dishes without breaking the bank. And at this already $$$$ restaurant, that's more value for your monayyyy. We arrived promptly before our reservation time and were told you go enjoy ourselves at the lounge first while they set our table. The lounge was packed full of people. There was hardly anywhere to stand. But wowzer, THE VIEW. It was stunning. You could see the curve of the Thames and Tower Bridge. It looked so small from up there. I have to say that this was my favorite view out of all the rooftop bars, restaurants in towers, etc. This was it. It's really gorgeous.When we finally got seated, we figured the evening called for wine and cocktails. We then went about ordering pretty much everything on the menu. My FAVORITES for the night included:-lobster & scallop ceviche, jalapeno, coriander & sweet pepper 21-grilled diver scallops, sweetcorn & black pepper, rocket butter 16.5-seared beef, lime, chilli, garlic & ginger dressing 13-sweetcorn & summer truffle 9-veal chop and gremolata 34-roasted cauliflower, almonds & caper berries 7NOT my favorites:-crispy pork belly, apple chutney & mustard seeds 18-macaroni & cheese 5.5-bone in rib-eye (800g) 65-duck with mango chutney 26-steak tartare, beef tomato, grilled sour dough 14The "not my favorites" dishes needed some work. They were either tasteless or overcooked or something. Given that the restaurant was still pretty new at the time, I'm just going to assume they were still working out the kinks. But even though the food was probably an overall 3 star rating, I still had a lovely experience. I was in good company overlooking London from the newly opened Shard from the 32rd floor. Life was good.

photos.caption: Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom. Amazing!
Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom. Pork belly
Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom. Sweet corn and summer truffle

7M9qMQbcYBkdThitZyNFCA.text: Shard was on my must-go-visit building while visiting in London. I thought there must be a fantastic lounge/restaurant in it that I can sip a flute of sparkling champagne and stunned by surrounding London city views. There must be one!! I was right!! I found oblix at the shard. Took my lovely girlfriend up to 32th floor, we both were amazed by the views greeting us. We came in around happy hours in the late afternoon, the lounge was full of 007 James Bond type British gentlemen. It didn't take us too long to be seated. We lucky found a small table right by the window. Ordered a bottle of wine we girls started taking all kinds of selfies and pictures. The price of wine was pretty reasonable. We both got a little bit tipsy and had millions of pictures in our cameras. What a wonderful night !!!

photos.caption: Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom

ZYTD1AXwNGSpDLSJnoGT0Q.text: I took my friend up here for drinks and nibbles for her bday and this place did not disappoint. We both had a couple cocktails- pink Cadillacs, which were dangerously yummy. We also had the calamari/squid which was the best thing ever. The lime and chilli added the right amount of kick - delicious. We also had the chips and padron peppers. The chips were good but the peppers j would give a miss. Of course the view was amazing so I would say that brings this place up a notch. It is loud on a Saturday night so don't be surprised with that. I will of course come back :)

RgGcOwcNqyNN39NvrQ4n4Q.text: Whilst chatting to Jesse, Andrew M's friend who was visiting from the States, I found out that his mother used to be a food critic for the Washington Post. She had some words of wisdom accumulated from years of experience. The most amusing was to eat somewhere that you see customers arguing with each other, the reason being that these customers must love the restaurant to come back so often that they are comfortable enough to be seen arguing in public!However, her most pertinent advice was to avoid eating anywhere with a spectacular view as you'll be paying largely for the view and not the quality of the food. This was because we were having this conversation eating at Oblix at the Shard, London's newly opened tallest building in Europe. Andrew had kindly organised a table for 5 of us to experience one of London's highest restaurants, though being on the 32nd floor puts the restaurant only about halfway up the towerNo matter that it isn't near the top because the view is spectacular and on a clear night like the night we were there, the Shard's location right on the river near London Bridge station means that you can take in London's iconic sights such as Tower Bridge, Tower of London, Canary Wharf and the O2 from the lounge side of the building and the London Eye. Houses of Parliament and Wembley from the restaurant side. The view here trumps that from Duck & Waffle, which is located on the 42nd floor of the Heron BuildingA month since opening, they've still not updated their website to include menus. This is extremely frustrating - why have a website and not put your menu up?We arrived a little early and were directed to the Lounge, where there was a live jazz band playing. However, it was rammed and every time we tried to sit at a table when someone left, we were shooed away as it was reserved. In fact, having intended to get a drink, we actually left as it was unpleasant and there wasn't even anywhere to stand comfortably as the floor space is packed with tables. When it's more comfortable to stand by the lifts rather than wait in the lounge, there's something not quite rightBang on our reservation time, we were led to our table. The walk through the kitchen is a nice touch for a foodie like me and the lady who showed us to our table was patient in what must be a frequent thing with guests stopping to take photos of the view (everyone else) and the food and kitchen (me!). 5 of us were then crammed into a table only really big enough for 4 people. Not cool when you've made a reservationI then had to turn on the torch app on my iPhone to be able to read the menu. You can tell how dark it was from my photos. There was only 1 spotlight on the table and the rest of it was in darkness. It was also extremely noisy. Although we were crammed onto the small table, it was very hard to have a conversation with anyone except the person next to youThe food is 'designed for sharing' according to the menu - ie the main courses come with no accompaniments and sides run around the £7 - 8 mark. Definitely come in a bigger group as we did so that you get to try a variety of dishesFor starters, we had scallop & lobster ceviche, seared scallops, seared beef, and beef tartare. All competent but the prices were expensive for the quality of cooking and portion sizes. I did like the olive bread thoughFor mains, we went for roast duck, belly pork, veal chop, bone-in ribeye and a host of sides including sweetcorn with summer truffle and roasted cauliflower. My favourite was the duck, which was juicy and moist as was the belly pork. The rest of the dishes were competently cooked but not worth the price they were chargingDesserts brought a pecan & chocolate bar, a cookie jar and trio of sorbets.With 2 bottles of wine and 2 bottles of mineral water, we paid around £70 a head. If you take off the £25 we would have paid per person to go up the Shard if we were paying just to go up for the view, the meal would weigh in at £45 per person and even at this reduced price, I would have to judge our visit a 3 star experienceI think Oblix is going to have an LA vibe - a place for celebrities and beautiful to hang out to be seen as much as to dine. I heard that Jennifer Lopez and Jamie Oliver have already eaten here.If you have a date you really want to impress, bring them here for the view and pay the maitre d' a little extra to make sure you get a table right by the window and you're onto a winner but only if you also pick up the tab

photos.caption: Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom. Lounge
Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom. Live music in the lounge
Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom. Lounge

vtuM2eusqrwkAiEukcprCw.text: You are here for the view, right? The food is almost irrelevant. If only I truly believed that then I'd be more impressed. We went with some friends who were visiting London so they were very impressed with view. The food was all grilled/BBQ type things so looking good.I got the salt & pepper squid to start and it had a real MSG taste to it (though I don't actually know if it had any in it). I didn't love it and wish I'd gone for the buffalo mozzarella starter. I got the pork main & it just seemed a little dry,  didn't love it and wish I'd gone for the steak. I did however enjoy the sides. Green beans were really good.It's a good place to go for ok food & a great view.

zIX1WHAtl8itT2a2WNWcMA.text: So without trying to sound bratty I'll explain what happened when trying to go here for a drink. We were told no trainers, only shoes. It doesn't matter if you're stylish or if you're wearing Yeezys, no trainers and only jackets. Don't worry about style, just wear leather shoes and a cheap jacket.

SvhSgtsC4yEfL4KuXujkLQ.text: Perfect spot for a special event or Jude's a great dinner! The lounge is gorgeous with sofas and live music, not to mention the excellent cocktails. If you're going for dinner get there early to enjoy an aperitif here. The food to top class and the portions are ample so bring your appetite. The dim lighting, soft jazzy music, chic atmosphere and killer views make this restaurant excellent addition to the area. Expensive, but an experience you won't forget.

photos.caption: Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom. Gorge views of London!
Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom

SSL18MrNpYiOlD4GebyG0g.text: Great views! My wine was amazing! This place is probably a bit touristy but that didn't bother me. Service was great. Wish we'd won the table by the window "lottery" but we still had a great view. I would love to come again.

YjI7ITvhStlY_lergrSOEQ.text: Highly recommend coming here to get an awesome view of London while enjoying a cocktail. You might have to wait a little to get a seat, but the service here seems pretty great. We were able to get upstairs right away and had drinks in our hands within a couple minutes. Heard the food is also amazing here; definitely coming back to try it out. I hope they get their windows cleaned by then :)

BmxBMpctxICVwamLuMsQJQ.text: Food was fantastic, staff was friendly. A little expensive... But if you're up for a big night out, give it a try.

mE-Gnm4zg8BDYljwey9CSA.text: Yeah, yeah the views are stunning.My friends and I stopped in for a few drinks as we were nearby. I like the entrance here, dark, mysterious, water and wood. Then into the light, warm wood space of the bar.My review is solely for the bar, which also takes table reservations and you will need one here because it was packed out. I don't like that because I don't want to be that up close and personal to anyone I'm not intimate with. It would help if a few tables were taken out of the floor area.It's a nice looking space and they have an area for live music too. Pleasant service and appropriately dressed patrons. This is my (and my friends) kind of bar. We will defo come back for an evening session.It's gorgeous here.

rVJb7F4Y43EhOCN6LAyCuQ.text: Nice restaurant at the shard, but only windows tables enjoy the view for the rest of us is just another london upscale restaurant.Reserving a table is not easy and the place is always full and very noisy. Quite dark as well.Entrance is through the kitchen where you can see a lot of fresh meat...don't come here if you are a vegetarian...Menu is nice, a lot of good food although nothing excellent.At the shard I still prefer aqua.

NYmRpWiUBh6evxIN4Hv-Rw.text: Met at the Oblix for dinner with another couple and was amazed as soon as I walked up to the door. Restaurant is located in the Shard and from the door to check in, everything gives off trendy chic. I felt I was in a movie (a la Will Smith's Hitch) and we only made it to the bar. Food was amazing and the view was breathtaking. We got there early at 6pm but turns out it was perfect timing as we were able to see the sun set against the city skyline. Service was good (not as good as some other top notch places I've  been) but the Sommelier made the night with his after dinner tour of the wine cellar and knowledge he expounded while selecting a desert wine for us (all of which was after we paid for our meals). Price is a bit high but was well worth it! Over all a great experience!

csCgK9eK8lXlhWdhqO5YvA.text: All views, no class   This restaurant is tun like a cheap russian mafia club, bouncets and all.  This is not European fine dining, this is pretend-posh clubbing trying to pass for it with overpriced, underwheling food, if it can be called that.

6LZV-TMg6oTZEl9lqw0ucw.text: Very accommodating, even though we were 15min late they took us in and sat us on a table by the window. Views are breathtaking. excellent quality in food and presentation. New Zealand pinot noir was superb. good timing in between dishes and efficient service. expensive but worths the ££.

photos.caption: Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom

EZpTrKr9jHFvpEbni3Xf4A.text: With Hutong's negative impression I didn't expect decent food at landscape restaurant, however I was wrong. I lux showed level of respect to the food and presented it in a pleasant way. We had crispy squid which was very tasty. Soft shell crab and sirloin steak for two. It was all fine and above average. I give it 5 star for sake of pressing down rubbish Hutong.

MT9B2kIUQnihXqFOajbTBA.text: Being up on the 32nd floor of the Shard is a treat, all by itself. You're afforded the most amazing views, unobscured by nearby skyscrapers in a beautiful setting.We'd arrived early and were guided to the bar whilst we waited for our table. Unfortunately, being a weekday evening in Central London, there was no available seating.Actually, that's a lie - there was LOADS of available seats. The problem? They were all reserved. Lets look past the fact that the seats in the bar area were reservable, but that they were empty.. just begging to be sat on. And we had to stand. Yes, this is #FirstWorldProblems at its finest.However, we got a drink at the bar and the lovely bartender made us several Mocktails and was very charming. In a small incident, my dinner date found a hair in her drink, and on letting the bartender know, she apologised and proceeded to make another drink, on the house.20 minutes later, and fighting the temptation to just sit on the piano seat and pretend I'm tonight's entertainment, we headed over to the restaurant where a hostess looked very confused by the prospect that we could possibly have something called a 'reservation' for dinner.She went away to confer with her colleagues, and came back after a few minutes to inform us that our table was being prepared (80% of the restaurant's tables, though prepared, were yet to be filled) and we took a seat whilst we our already prepared table was.. err.. prepared.Once seated however, our waiter was a delight and made us feel right at home and everything that happened prior was suddenly a distant memory. He was friendly, funny and charming, without being too imposing, which is just about all you need from your waiter.The food was lush too - I ordered the Rib-eye steak (Medium-Rare), and my dinner date opted for the Lamb chops, with harissa and yoghurt. Both came out cooked incredibly well and we were left very happy.We'd been unlucky in our timing not to have gotten a table next to the windows, but somewhere between the main course and dessert, I cheekily summoned the courage to ask if we could move to the recently vacated table seat, and the waiter (after a quick check with his manager) gave the sly wink that we could move across, and he happily took our photo for us (even telling us to perk up our pose!)All in all, Oblix is a great night out, though definitely not light on the bank balance. Much recommended for a special occasion, and definitely pop back into the bar after your meal, as there is often live music on.

KYAzis_kmBtLDMsnGyHmaA.text: Last year I had the BEST duck Sunday roast I've ever had and I have been meaning to come back ever since. The duck was melted in my mouth and was perfectly cooked. This time things were not quite this good. The duck was probably 30sec to a minute over cooked and not pink and was a bit chewy but still good. We had the octopus and burrata starters which were delicious. The service was. so. Weird. I was really entertained people watching. Lots of dishes being dropped and cracking (at least 3 in the hour I was there) then a waiter literally poured the entire glass of coke onto a customer and he was silently furious. Also saw very some very aggravated wait staff arguing w the manager. One thing that was annoying was that it was really difficult to get my water refilled!! Jesus I didn't want to spend £12 on a bottle of water but I was seriously thirsty. Anyways, it wasn't as good as it once was but wasn't terrible. Is it worth £50 for a Sunday roast?? Maybe- there's the view and the entertaining wait staff but maybe bring your own water??

7xpLmSZO6JL42I6L9Jr8yQ.text: Been here twice while in town with clients. The view is one of the most amazing in the world. Staff is professional and most important food is amazing! Will be back again soon!

QQxx4rfDDyekhjGzXHxeaw.text: We had a wonderful time , specially Janathan the manager was extremely helpful and kind to change our table and at the end surprised us with the birthday desert with candle and special birthday wishes message .The food was excellent and so was the suggested wine .

photos.caption: Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom. Beautiful view

GD2gsT6Ypb7pVLDgzA8Bkw.text: I travel for a living and have eaten in literally thousands of restaurants all over the world.  I have never once been told that I couldn't order dessert because our time was up...until tonight.  Had we been the cause of a slow dining experience, (being indecisive about what to order, lingering and/or taking our time) I could understand being politely reminded by the staff that other people were waiting for our table.  However, we had absolutely nothing to do with the slow pace of our dining experience.  We arrived a few minutes before our 6:00 reservation and were seated straight away.  Got a nice table next to the windows with a beautiful view of the city.  Server was pleasant and took our order.  We placed our FULL order as soon as we were able within a few minutes after being seated.  We were served the pre-appetizers promptly and shortly thereafter we were served the salads.  We sat for a considerable amount of time waiting for the hot main dishes.  One of the dishes was a beef dish that the server said would take up to 45 minutes to prepare.  We were ok with the prep time...there was no mention at all of the possibility that the 45 -50 minute prep time might prevent us from having time to enjoy dessert.  Once the hot/main dishes were served, we ate them straight away.  In fact, it was very quiet at our table (little conversation) because all were devouring the delicious food.  After we finished our meal, at our first opportunity to do so, we asked the server if we could see the dessert menu.  It was at that time, our server  informed us that our time was up and that we could not order dessert.  We spent a lot of money (~£300) for a nice meal and were were rushed out before we even had the opportunity to see a dessert menu.  After all of the fuss to get us out, we waited an additional 15 minutes to get our bill.  Just a total bummer for what otherwise would have been a wonderful meal.  I will not be returning and I will not be recommending this restaurant to anyone.

Bj5HIAtzzyQAxF88PV_Glg.text: Looked forward to dining here as love the Shard.  Bookatable was offering a really affordable deal. The layout of the Lounge meant that you could sit anywhere and you could get a view except a couple of black spots.  All the tables by the windows are tables for two, some bar chairs in one corner, and the tables that are more into the centre of the Lounge were high tables with high seating so you could still get a view. I originally booked for four on the bookatable website, because they were doing an amazing deal for 3 courses plus a glass of bubbly for £32, but I had to change the reservation at the last minute to increase our numbers, but was unable to do so when I called the restaurant, because I had made the booking online.  When I enquired with bookatable, they said I needed to contact the restaurant, as their online booking did not have the facility to amend the booking, only to cancel.  So it was catch 22!  I spoke to the restaurant again, and finally, the reservations person, heard my predicament and plea, and amended my booking, and booked me into the Lounge, and I was told the seating there is very comfortable with sofas at tables, and tables with very comfortable high chairs. Which all sounded really interesting.  But what a palaver with the booking system.However, all was redeemed as on arrival, the welcome was lovely and attentive.  We were seated at a table with really comfortable seating in an U-shaped settee facing into the room, and one part facing the window, with the lovely views of the Walkie Talkie building, the Gherkin, Tower Bridge and Tower of London.  At the other end, there is also a view of the railways running right below the building going east. The atmosphere was very relaxed and the service was very observant, but not obtrusive. The starters were really substantial and was fine, but the mains were not as good.  My crab and chili linguine was quite salty and the steak was very, very chewy. The chips, however, were divine, and very more-ish.  The best dishes was the duck, which went well with the mango and watercress salad; and the salmon nicoise, which was perfectly cooked.Then on to the desserts, the blackberry and apple eclair sounded really yummy on paper, but when it came it looked really strange like a long cigar filled with cream and decorated with blackberries, and did not taste that great, and was quite sour.  The flourless chocolate cake with ice cream fared a bit better, but nothing special.  So all in all, lovely views, lovely service, but some of the food, even though looks great, could have been better.

photos.caption: Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom. Salmon Nicoise
Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom. Lovely views of London skyline and River Thames
Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom. Crab and chili Linguine

FDGJLXF9tSCuPNX8IxDqlw.text: Top notch bar.Waitress were both friendly and knew what they were talking about. What drinks to recommend exactly where I wanted to be seated ;)The view it's self is what you come for.Breath taking ! Go at night time the lights will make you ou and aw.Of course it's a dress code make sure u don't wear running shoes tho... The other side of the shard there's a resto that wouldn't let my boyfriend in even tho they were brand new all black Jordans but the oblix didn't mind. So I mean you could give them a tip but might as well just cross over.'Twas a excellent way to end our last night in London.I recommend coming here to anyone who is in the moodFor a romantic one on one night or even bday party.

MwK0Z6qQntc1QQa-o804HQ.text: What a cool experience. You take an elevator to the top of "The Shard" which is a very tall glass building. Once in the Oblix, there's a very hip/modern feel. The cocktails are their specialty and they're delicious. I also had the calamari, yum, so good. There are views of London Bridge and other London sites. I'd recommend dressing up a little as you will feel out of place if you wear jeans and a tshirt.

photos.caption: Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom

NIy_8wETCgVEFXjwGJ6LFg.text: The view is amazing and the truffle green beans are to die for!!The restaurant has an open kitchen so you'll see all the action! The chef was amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom. Dinner!

j2Yect5g_QADdgf8iejp8A.text: This place is good for relaxing your feet after long walk of sightseeing as well as for a special occation!One of my friends knows some very classy places in London and she told us we could go and enjoy the view before we saw another friends off in London Bridge station.After we arrived at the entrance, the receptionists welcomed us and we were sent to a table next to the windows! We enjoyed a very lovely view of Tower Bridge from the seats. The cocktails were quite pricy (on average £15) but it's reasonable when you consider the entrance fee of the shard.We didn't order any food but there was a buffet counter which had some really really attractive foods and cakes. They were shining.However some of the waitors weren't kind so we couldn't ask them to take photo of us, which was a shame. But I'm looking forward to tasting the shining food and dessert soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom

axGQ11lTJiS6Y8YKxVsGSQ.text: Hmm.... I don't really know how I feel because I feel like my views will kinda be made bias by how amazing the view was since it was on the nth floor in the shard. The service would good if they assume you're rich. In which case, it was good for us, since we are literally experts at pretending to be rich. Watching downtown abbey surely takes a good toll on a man. I really want to say the food was amazing but it wasn't. Maybe I was expecting more or better qualitied food to compliment the fantastic view. But it's a place for the rich, surely to flaunt wealth, not to enjoy food.

sjwKYC5RcgD2DFeF9wfe8A.text: If Oblix wasn't where it was, this would be a 3 star...So I think 4 is pretty generous here.I was pretty excited by Oblix, a fancy restaurant-but with a simple menu with food that would appeal to all. The restaurant itself is pretty amazing, I loved the open kitchen, seating, layout and the huge fridge full of meat! Service was as expected, drinks where lovely, but it was the food itself which let me down a bit...and that is what a restaurant is all about really!To Start I went for the Beef Tartare, this was the best bit of the meal. fresh, juicy and a good sized portion. We were off to a good start!Up next I was going to go for the Duck and Mango, but they had sold out (not the end of the world, but not ideal for a lunchtime service), so instead I went with the Black Cod. It was nice, but it was nowhere near the levels I expected and compared to my favourite (ROKA if you're asking) it was just average.Other people on my table opted for the steak, again it was nice, but nothing compared to the likes of Goodman,s Gaucho and Hawksmoor.Overall the food was good, but I don't think the fact you have a nice view, means a place can compromise on the quality of food. If you want to charge high end prices that's fine, but it needs to be on par with other places that do the same, and Oblix just wasn't.One other thing which isn't really the restaurants fault...the views are amazing, but the windows are terrible because of the design of the building, so any fancy pics will have a bit of a reflection on them!

photos.caption: Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom. Oblix-Meat Fridge!
Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom. Oblix-Bone In Ribeye Rare (Share platter)
Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom. Oblix Beef Tatare Starter

QNCc9YJALdQ3Y2GxfgUZDw.text: Had cocktails here on a Friday night. They don't limit the amount of people that can go in so it can get very packed. The bar area is actually really small and there are practically no seats available even though there's plenty of seating on the restaurant side.It's dark, crowded and drinks are crazy expensive, but the views are pretty nice. Good for a quick drink!

photos.caption: Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom. View from the oblix
Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom. View
Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom. Cocktails

WaIstgqhfZLNUemC0q9k0Q.text: I'm surprised by the negative reviews, as I had an amazing late lunch on a Sunday afternoon.I ordered the friends octopus with avocado and grapefruit (amazing with a garlic aeoli drizzled onto the plate), a sirloin steak (served with 3 sauces chimichurri, bernaise, and a pepper sauce), and a tomato salad on a smear of babaganoush. Excellent, every course.It didn't hurt that I was at a bar with a view directly over west end London with St. Paul's, parliament, and the London eye all in sight.It's a little pricy, but that wasn't a surprise. It's a exclusive location, with a menu to match. Well done.

photos.caption: Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom. Sirloin
Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom. Octopus with avocado
Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom

huo7lsyoIcaEl3FPRiR0Dg.text: Lovely staff, gorgeous food and jaw-dropping views. Went to Oblix at the Shard for my birthday and absolutely loved it. Even got a personalised dessert! A tad expensive and would probably not go there unless it was a special occasion but I thoroughly enjoyed my visit there. Next time I would probably pay slightly extra to sit next to the window. Mind the dress code as trainers are not allowed.

vV3us8sXX0wQX1rNeMF2aA.text: Not too shabby but very expensive! The ambient lighting and mood is very relaxing. We didn't need to reserve either, we were seated instantly on an already reserved table which was great :)So the cocktails are about £15 each and the snacking food was about £10-£12 a tiny plate but I must say, both very enjoyable! If you visit, do expect to pay about £100 just for a couple of drinks and a light snack! It's got a wonderful view as you can imagine and a very stylish bar indeed! As you can imagine, there is a dress code so don't rack up in trainers expecting to go right on up!Recommend their own cocktails which are served in unique glasses.

BeZe6ZmfFO9mOAGs4ZNstg.text: My wife and I enjoyed one of the most unforgettable nights of our lives while dining here. It all starts with the view of the city while you're 32 stories above street level. From there it just gets better with each course. The cocktails were good, Caesar salad was delicious and creative, and the dinner was the shared suckling pig. Again, unforgettable and a meal we won't soon forget. This was one of the most expensive meals we've ever had, but well worth the experience.

0v0bfkoePIYAd7wN3mmHdA.text: Stunning view...Lovely restaurant with an amazing view! On arrival we were greeted and take  to he bar for a pre-dinner cocktail.  These were to die for!  Allowing us all a moment to leave our days behind...When we reached our table were we presented with a lovely refreshing and original menu with lots of choices.  Every dish was tasty and well presented.Would visit again!

photos.caption: Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom

XJHkpqD3CEzpoQCdiCp7kg.text: Despite being separated from the Shangri-La by only 3 floors, we had to take a lift all the way down to ground, walk around to the separate entrance to Oblix and take another ear-popping lift back up into the air to get to this bar. We were after some post-dinner drinks and that mission only added to our thirst! We hesitated at the door though when told that there was live music on for an extra £5pp cover charge - would it be worth it? Thankfully the lady on the door sensed our dilemma and said we were welcome to go and have a look inside first, but warned us there was only standing room at the bar. What a fib. We followed the buzz down the long dimly-lit corridor to find several empty bar stools at the high tables next to the bar and quickly nabbed 3, as there was a live jazz singer on who sounded pretty good. Not sure why the lady outside had been telling people the bar seating was full - perhaps their reservation system doesn't account for when people leave?!We were served at the table (eventually) by a friendly French-accented waiter, who I confess I'd thought had approached my colleague to try and chat her up initially given he was wearing a suit! The other two ordered Ginger cocktails, with one actually asking for less rum than standard (madness I know) and we ended up drinking half of them by trying to taste-test which one was which! I got a Lemongrass sparkling cocktail with gin, lime and prosecco which was disappointingly quite flavourless, almost as if all the tasty ingredients cancelled each other out.There's plenty of flattering low lighting plus the smooth jazz that would make this a romantic drinks stop - in fact we went to see the exact corner where one of the other girls got proposed to a few months earlier! But be aware the bar is in the centre of the room and competition for the best views by the windows is high - beautiful yes, but you've got more chance of enjoying those elsewhere in the Shard.It turned into a pricey stop for a flavourless cocktail, but at least I know what not to order next time. Though the spendy cocktail competition around this price point is so high (quite literally in this case - see what I did there?!) that I'm not in any rush to go back.

Xfnruasm7Y4N_5FClpCbXQ.text: Oblix is unsurpassed in service. I mean wow these guys work extremely well to give you the most special and memorable experience. It is managed or rather orchestrated thoughtfully and with the utmost attention to detail. Unlike most places in London, the reception is warm, attentive, sharp, organised and on point. The best welcome to start a gorgeous evening. First of all we decided to dine in the lounge as we love live music. The food was great! It's all about the sharing plates. We loved the octopus, spare ribs, tiger prawn, sirloin, and squid. The cocktails were spectacular. The bartenders are on a different level. My lavender cocktail lifted me to a spa in bora bora. You have to try the dessert cocktails too. Swoon. Get dessert. Chocolate brownie sundae! Yum. The live music was surreal. The singer was a power house and very reminiscent of Aretha Franklin. From the 32nd floor, I was definitely on cloud 9! I'm truly grateful to have spent our 2nd year anniversary here in the most special and magical way. Thank you!

photos.caption: Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom. The view!

JJrRPUwYiEzzyPoFOk3YoA.text: You obviously go for the view. It's good, wish they had cleaner Windows so that you could have a clearer view of outside.Food was average, drinks were good.The coconut drink had a great flavor to it and I really liked the old fashioned.Service - embarrassing.Let's go over a few things, maybe it's a London thing but service was terrible.I can tolerate not having great service, I've noticed in London they don't check on you much especially after they ve taken your order. Had to wave someone down for a second drink.The bill comes, they added a service charge. I can accept that, it's probably the norm here. Not a problem. I pay in cash. I am owed change.It takes them twenty minutes for someone to come back to me and go he needs to get a manager because he's not allowed to deal with the cash, and so is unable to give me my change.We arnt talking that much money here by the way.That's funny, so you work here but only certain people are allowed to handle the cash? Ok that maybe true, well stop bothering me and making me wait and get your manager to take care of it.Another 15 minutes, I'm assuming the manager is this tall blonde woman who was dressed well. I'm watching and she is walking around aimlessly not taking care of anything in particular. It got to a point that it just was not worth it to me. I walked away.Very disappointed I will not be back here, there are other restaurants in the building.If you want to claim to be one of the better restaurants in London act like it. Poor service average food and your only thing is drinks in my mind.

OI_eBlSQMjOH6Zfe8-xWUw.text: The view was great, food was better than average, drinks were great and service was too considering how packed this place was on a Friday night. They have a DJ and they play great music. Wish there  was dancing.

photos.caption: Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom

I1hQ1UDURvJ6Gcbex5EtYQ.text: With any one of these elements, you can still have an acceptable restaurant:       small portions;    high prices;    snobbery;    imperfect service.This place has all four and an amazing view of downtown London. Ride the Eye and eat elsewhere.

KLoyUZNTYbw01yVXKMYOVw.text: Spectacular views, great food, and amazing service! The Oblix at the Shard is a win! Husband and I went to dinner there on our last night of our London trip. What a fantastic way to end the vacation. We made reservations 3 months prior. This chic restaurant provided excellent customer service from the moment we walked into the moment we left.

dU-clEB-r-HIqdmb_c97jg.text: The Oblix overall is unnecessarily snobby. It is a fine dining restaurant but we stopped in for lunch after walking around London all morning. My husband was asked to remove his ball cap, no problem - but they sent a manager to do it. Why didn't the hostess out front take it before we walked in when she took our coats? Why didn't the first server, or second server say something?   That just makes it a point of embarrassment instead of a simple dress code standard. The hostess seemed shocked we didn't have a lunch reservation and made it seem like they were squeezing us in (to their nearly empty restaurant). We were given a beautiful table right by the window... without a reservation.We felt like our server was disappointed we only wanted appetizers and cocktails to start. I told her we'd take it from there with a main course but she chose to neglect us. I had to call her over multiple times, which is disappointing for such a "high class" and expensive restaurant. We were so irritated we opted out of anything beyond the apps although that wasn't our original plan. The views from the shard are amazing, and the food and drinks are delicious. But if I'm being honest, we had better food for much less later that day at a place that didn't make us feel like we were below their standard. My recommendation would be to see the views, absolutely. But just get a cocktail - don't bother with food. Oh and maybe make a reservation to avoid shocking the staff.

VslI0ytMIIaKCt-31_1uIQ.text: I'm glad I finally got the chance to visit the Shard recently. To set the scene, you tell the doorman which restaurant you're going to and he directs you to the security check inside. Once through the security check, you enter the lift to go to the 32nd floor. Once on the 32nd floor, you're greeted by a host/hostess who let you know about the seating situation. My mum and I were just there for drinks, and we were told that the bar was at capacity, but that we can go in and find a spot (the host admitted to saying that the bar was at capacity because there was a family of four ahead of us that wanted to go in and they didn't want the kids in there). We walked in and noticed that the bar was nowhere near full capacity. Anyway, Mum and I settled in and ordered a wonderful half bottle of rosé sparkling wine. We couldn't help but notice that the smart casual dress code wasn't being upheld, hence my low-star review. Now, if the dress code has been relaxed, then my apologies for not being aware. But I saw plenty of people in the bar with trainers/sports shoes and more casual than smart attire. Even with these drawbacks and the pricey drinks, I'd still recommend Oblix for the atmosphere and the amazing view.

b3CbGMyuFq_FU9fw9WOeqw.text: We had paid a lot of money to come and eat a nice dinner. We ordered and it took a really long time for the meat to come which they said it would, but it took quite a while...So, we finished our meal and wanted to order some dessert and they told us "sorry your time is up. You can't order any dessert." My family and I did not procrastinate or dawdle. We sat there patiently and waited for the food to come(starving), not knowing that we wouldn't have time to eat dessert. If we knew we wouldn't have time to eat dessert, we would have ordered it sooner. Even though this place is fancy their service isn't all that good. Sorry but it's true. We would of probably had a better time at a cheaper restaurant.

LIBYiit89Ekm9qL4ezcNSw.text: ​Wonderful place to have dinner with a​ view in London. My kids and I enjoyed the place. The food and service are excellent!

eQQJQJKb92BYUnG20U42Kw.text: Wonderful dinner with my wife on our final evening in London.Top-notch staff make everything perfect.Noticed a family wearing trainers left waiting outside the lounge:Please refer to the Oblix rules (now referred to as the David J rules of dining and life):-No trainers-No ball caps -No kidsYou might wonder why, well there was a group of four obnoxious Americans in the dining room (including one clown with his glasses on his head, wearing trainers). This is the reason I did not give five stars. Couldn't anyone find an extra chicken bone somewhere to shove down this guy's throat to shut him up? Now, as for my man, Alex - wow! Alex made this surprise dinner for my wife perfect -with a front frown seat to the beautiful views.

photos.caption: Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom

QaUDPCZBdOGp6DAfH3g7Lw.text: I came here for the last meal while I was abroad with my family and was not disappointed. Although you will pay a pretty penny, if you can swing it I would highly suggest coming here.We got there early to walk around the restaurant and enjoy the view. We ordered drinks at the bar which was very fun. They have all these cool names and are unusual so we enjoyed trying them. My dad ordered a tequila cocktail and it had egg whites on it and a little bag of pistachio dust clipped to it. Very different but SO DELISH. Did not think I would like it but I would have ordered one for myself. I had a Las Vegas showgirl that was something along the lines of vodka and some juice. At the bottom was a lip candy which was a cute/funny little addition. It was a good drink but the tequila was way better.We finally sat down and ordered. I got a lobster tail and prime rib. HOLY MOLEY! Talk about melt in your mouth, dance around bc the food it that good. I was so impressed and would eat it for every meal if I could. It was served with a "salsa verde" which I would have classified as more of a pesto type sauce-regardless it was delicious. We ordered a bunch of sides and shared them all. The Mac and cheese/potatoes being my favorite! The service was good and I would definitely return when I have the extra funds. Tip! Order drinks and walk around, the view is impeccable and you won't regret it!

photos.caption: Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom. Lobster tail/prime rib
Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom. My fun drink
Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom. Tequila/pistachio/egg white drink

01Rh5WFVCBhyYDkwVHAo0w.text: When you first walk into the Shard, there is a security check and scan before you enter the elevators. Once you get in the elevators, no need to press any buttons and just enjoy the quick 15 second ride up to the 32nd floor. Oblix shares the same floor as the the other restaurants but is located on one side. There is coat check available before you enter in the restaurant. To go through the seating area you'll first walk through the open front kitchen. It's a cool design concept in my opinion but also feels rather strange since its brightly lit and then you immediately switch over to a dimly light dining area. My group of four was seated at a booth. The booth was quite nice and had the view of the wine room. We could see a bit of the London view from where we were but from a distance. To be honest, I don't think Oblix has the best view. Later we ventured over to the Hu Tong/Aqua Shard side and I liked their view a lot more.For starters, my group ordered the crab cakes and smoked salmon flatbread. Both were good dishes. The crab cakes were 2 pieces, warm and soft. They were served with a side salad. The smoked salmon flatbread was in a shape of a pizza. They definitely gave a generous helping of smoked salmon.For entrees we ordered duck for two, lobster and Bbq black cod. Our sides were mashed potatoes and mushrooms. Out of all the entrees I really enjoyed the Bbq black cod. It was so soft and perfect. I thought the BBQ sauce was a decent addition to the dish but didn't particularly enjoy the salsa side. The duck was also well cooked and not a bad dish. The lobster however was so dry and hardly had any meat on it. It was a rather disappointing dish. For desserts we ordered the cheesecake and seasonal Thai mango and exotic sorbet. I really enjoyed the mangoes! They were in season and just the best tasting mangoes. It combined really well with the three different sorbet flavors. I also got a fresh fruit juice which if I  am remember was a blend of grapefruit, passion fruit and one other fruit. It was delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom. Fresh fruit juice
Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom. Smoked salmon cream cheese flatbread
Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom. Crab cakes

KW-9k1Yp-rhX4Wo5gDLMeA.text: My wife and in-laws decided to grab a drink at the lounge to enjoy the view. We only had an hour to stay since we had dinner reservations elsewhere.Service was regrettably terrible. We were seated but there was no server attending to us. After 15 minutes, I had to go up to the bar to request service. The views are great but you're paying for it in the price of the drinks. Given the terrible service, the atmosphere was spoiled. Unless you're dressed proper, I feel like you won't be properly serviced and will be treated secondhand.

5X3-NlHwtj07JROlx0UNIg.text: Oblix is, you know, cray. You're going to spend a ton of money and see some great views. The food is definitely good, and it's a very cool set up because you walk past all the chef's cooking their beautiful dishes when going to your table. Unfortunately you cannot reserve a table directly by the windows, but you still have a lovely view no matter where you are. We went big here. We ordered the seafood sharing appetiser which was way too much money but very fun to look at. Seriously go look at the pictures. The experience was lovely, but it's probably not a place I would need to go to again, unless some out of towers insisted. The prices are high but for obvious reasons, and their food is very good. The aubergine flat bread was delicious, and the King Crab Risotto was chock-a-block filled with crab. Yes I did just say chock-a-block. I heard a woman say it the other day so it's a thing. I was very impressed, with the saying and the crab.

photos.caption: Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom. You walk through the kitchen on your way in
Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom. Honey and Parmesan nibbles
Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom. Aubergine flat bread

N8tSBo1hCkXRzgmx5wyAYQ.text: Wonderful views of London but average and over priced food. The decor is basic and the atmosphere is pretty dependent on the tourists that happen to have booked.

LKLniM6-1CJ-j-gZ5maDEg.text: To say that the views from Oblix are stunning is an understatement.  They are simply jaw dropping!  The food and the service equals the setting as well.The restaurant is a split level so you walk up multiple flights of stairs with 180 degree views of the city of London.  You can go here for cocktails and or dinner.The Asian cuisine was excellent.  We had Cuddle fish with a spicy hot pepper sauce, a very delicately prepared Cod, shredded beef, and some simply prepared Bok Choi.  Very well executed with unobtrusive service.  We were a large party and everything came out on time and as ordered.The food is very good but not terribly imaginative in terms of its preparation.  Let's face it; that isn't what you are paying for!  The views are the secret to this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom. Exterior view from Tower Hill
Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom. London bridge
Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom. The view from the entrance

Okd290Yy8ZKc99HOpM2weA.text: I wanted to try something a little more high-end for my last day in London. I ordered the T-Bone steak and it was remarkable! I had some Mac and cheese with mashed potatoes as my sides! Would definitely return, it was a great dining experience, and the view was spectacular! Hands down my favorite restaurant I visited to in London!

sjqK4PuU9Aw8UX39SKUI0w.text: You cannot beat the view!  Very impressive space.  Plan on being pushed to the bar upon arrival for the $20 cocktails as your table will not be ready on time. This is planned for sure.  When you arrive at the dining room you cannot help but be impressed with the view.  Service is over attentive, especially when it comes to pouring wine. This really bothers me. If I want another bottle, I'll order one. I don't need someone pushing the pour to get to another bottle prior to the next course, especially at this price point. The food was very good but definitely over priced.  Definitely a tourist trap looking to maximize your bill and move out as fast as possible. We were asked if we wanted to have coffee and dessert by the window bar seats in order to turn over our table.  We weren't five steps from the table when they whisked another party to our table. I get it, but at this price, I don't expect to be rushed, even when done well!

mAGZnaH-5geMjh1vWrzFLQ.text: So, let me say that the one star here is for Maria and GM Travis, who did everything they could to make a cruddy situation a little better. Props to them both. Otherwise, this would be zero stars if I could even do that.We're spending several days in London and decided to add this to the dinner plans on our second night in town. Lovely view, cool venue. Not as cool when we saw how insanely overpriced the drinks were. Seriously, @ £25 for Bulleit? But we figure, what the heck. It's a tourist trap anyhow, so why not? Really not cool when the Caesar salad shows up.I have my first bite and then see 2 hairs on what would have been the second bite. Gross. My husband tells a member of the wait staff, who clears the plate without comment and talks to the manager, but no one ever comes back to talk to us. Our original waiter brings the utensils for main course. Now we're confused. My husband gets up and speaks with Maria as no one has said anything about it to us, nor about replacing the salad, or taking it off the bill. Maria ends up coming to the table and made a kind gesture of sending over additional side dishes for our main course. The GM comes over in apologizes. We figure that this type of thing happens occasionally, so we proceed on with dinner.Then, my husband's steak arrives. It comes with a new bonus side dish, more hair on top. Not even joking.  We are now thoroughly grossed out. On top  of it all, my husband had planned a special  dessert with the restaurant for our anniversary. That was not going to be.The general manager now comes over And apologizes profusely. Super nasty. Super gross. Unless you enjoy flossing your teeth during dinner with another person's hair, I recommend you do not eat here.

fLqLZcjnhnXebZIHmEuzcA.text: This restaurant is stunning at night! The views are amazing. The food is perfection. You must try the green beans.. melts in your mouth! The staff was great!! Very romantic, relaxing atmosphere for a girls night or date night. I will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom. The Hummus was very good!
Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom. Views and Hummus.. yesss

HK7-brRGhhh_qLVPkqiKpA.text: I was a little disappointed by the restaurant at the Shard - Oblix.  The view is absolutely beautiful and I suggest making a reservation during sunset which is extremely beautiful.The food however is mediocre.  My husband got the Rib Eye which was pretty basic.  It was good, but nothing special.  I got the BBQ black cod which was quite unusual.  The BBQ sauce overpowered the dish and took over.  All I could taste was BBQ which is disappointing for me.  The fish did not seem very fresh and some parts were extremely fishy.  The appetizers and drinks were actually very good.  We have the Octopus and Tuna Tartar were fulfilling and delicious.All in all - it is an experience and I probably would not go again.  For someone debating whether or not to go - I suggest go for appetizers and drinks and skip the dinner portion.

photos.caption: Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom

c9UKUkjTjEzHh9RKWQSF3Q.text: The only good thing about this place is an amazing View !  We have booked the table at 9pm . Have to wait 30 min to be seated !   Keep asking 3 people for the table , they said receptionist will come to speak with us , no one came . Asked third time finally one arrived after 10 min showing us table . No apologies for delay .The food was ok . A bit pricey . But what to expect . The best dish lamb andChocolate brownie . Still worth to go , but maybe for the drink . There is bar area as well . Good selection of cocktails . Watermelon with prosseco highly recommend

photos.caption: Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Oblix At The Shard - London, United Kingdom. Lamb
